record.text: Thanks David! This semester has been been pretty rotten health-wise. I'm grateful to be feeling better, but I don't know how long it'll last...😥 Hopefully treating the symptoms will help me manage for now, while I try to find a good headache specialist here.

I just want those sweet recent packages with a little added stability that I don't have with arch or Debian unstable, that comes packaged with a DE that I don't hate (basically, not gnome), that doesn't come from canonical because they give me the ick for reasons I can't pin down.

This is what I'm saying, this is why I no longer use it.  Shouldn't be a requirement of any sensible personal computing environment imo.  I do not want operating my computer to be a hobby in and of itself, but it's great that you can.  DDoSing the aur is news to me, surely that's not intentional?

I also want something mostly configured the way I want out of the box.  When I was a teenager it was fun to mess around and configure everything exactly the way I want, but I no longer have the time or energy.  I just want to do work with my computer, not *on* it.

Like I don't even care if Copilot is bad, who cares, so is Teams, it still has a billion+ users because they have absolute market control. 

So where is the Copilot story? Outside of coding everyone is using it for office documents anyways.

What I don't get is why Copilot isn't the leader of the game, everyone uses Windows, everyone uses Office, I rarely find a business not using Sharepoint/Teams. 

My biggest AI fear is that MS will just make it mandatory and raise the price. 

But why do I hear so little about Copilot?

Yeah added to this is the modern notion of changing companies each 2 to 3 years. 

I work in IT, I'm a 110% sure most people have not achieved anything in those 2 to 3 years.

🎯 Satya Nadella tente d'expliquer cette contradiction :

"C'est l'énigme du succès dans une industrie sans valeur de franchise. Le progrès est dynamique, parfois dissonant..."

Une réflexion qui interroge sur l'avenir du travail 🤖

💼 La justification de Brad Smith (président Microsoft) :

"Les gains d'efficacité IA ne sont pas un facteur prédominant dans les licenciements"

Mais il reconnaît que les investissements créent une pression pour réduire les coûts... 🎭

📊 Copilot vs Gemini : le match des IA

• Microsoft Copilot : 100M d'utilisateurs
• Google Gemini : 450M d'utilisateurs

Malgré ses investissements massifs, Microsoft reste distancé par Google sur l'adoption grand public 🤔
Same 😭 but my brain has trouble on literally all other softwares because word is familiar  and I hate it

With the Huey, I was like 12 and it was a county fair, I sat in the copilot seat, the guy said I flew in Vietnam, should we fly like that?

I’m like yeah! So we are so close to the tree line you could see the surprise on peoples faces canoeing.

I thought of that when I saw apocalypse now.

I know a lawyer for the company with a plane with a parachute in it, he said they’d had no casualties since introducing that, making it the easiest legal job in aviation.

Unlike working for Boeing.

He took me up on one, it was an amazing plane.

Prior rode in Cessnas airline and once a Huey.

Bc it’s not as good at maneuvering as the f-16 or Rafael, or the eurofighter or certainly not the f-22.

But enemies, let’s only fight when it’s sunny.

Oh, if we turn coat on you we turn it off.

Plus I hear they cost a fortune to maintain and only 52% of us f-35 can fly due to maintenance.

Pass.

record.text:
ChatGPT's New Study Mode Is Designed To Help You Learn, Not Just Give Answers

Concerns about students using large language models like ChatGPT to cheat in college are widespread.  In response, OpenAI has launched "Study Mode," a new feature aimed at fostering deeper understa…

#chatgpt #gpt #openai

external.description: Concerns about students using large language models like ChatGPT to cheat in college are widespread.  In response, OpenAI has launched "Study Mode," a new feature aimed at fostering deeper understanding rather than simply providing answers.  This mode utilizes custom system instructions developed with educators and experts to guide learning.  Unlike standard ChatGPT, Study Mode presents information in a scaffolded manner, employing Socratic questioning and knowledge checks.  It also offers personalized feedback to ensure comprehension before proceeding.  During a demo, Study Mode responded to a game theory request by first assessing user familiarity and purpose.  It then provided a concise overview, asked a guiding question, and offered a real-world example.  For a complex math problem, Study Mode consistently redirected requests for direct answers towards problem-solving steps.  While it may eventually offer solutions upon repeated requests, its primary design emphasizes a tutoring approach.  OpenAI claims Study Mode reduces the risk of hallucination by processing information in smaller, calibrated chunks.  However, OpenAI acknowledges that the current version may exhibit inconsistent behavior and mistakes.
external.title: ChatGPT's New Study Mode Is Designed To Help You Learn, Not Just Give Answers

screenshot of four paragraphs of Microsoft annual report. a blue highlight is over the following sentence: "Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more." The full four paragraphs are as follows:

Microsoft is a technology company committed to making digital technology and artificial intelligence (“AI”) available broadly and doing so responsibly. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. 

We develop and support a broad portfolio of technology solutions for individuals and businesses, focusing on secure, trusted, and innovative platforms and tools that meet evolving customer needs across cloud computing, productivity and collaboration, and personal computing. We strive to create opportunity, growth, and impact in every country around the world.

AI is fundamentally transforming productivity for every individual, organization, and industry. Microsoft's AI offerings span every layer of the technology stack, enabling transformative outcomes across sectors and unlocking opportunity for every country, community, and individual. 

We believe AI should be as empowering as it is powerful, and we’re committed to designing and deploying AI responsibly with safety and security from the outset.

While AI is becoming better at generating that functional code, it is also enabling attackers to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in that code more quickly and effectively. This…

external.description: While AI is becoming better at generating that functional code, it is also enabling attackers to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in that code more quickly and effectively. This is making it easier for less-skilled programmers to attack the code, increasing the speed and sophistication of those attacks — creating a situation in which code vulnerabilities are increasing even as the ability to exploit them is becoming easier, according to new research from application risk management software provider Veracode.

A quotation from Franklin Roosevelt

I believe that the recent course of our history has demonstrated that, while we may utilize their expert knowledge of certain problems and the special facilities with which they are familiar, we cannot allow our economic life to be controlled by that small group of men whose chief outlook upon the social welfare is tinctured by the fact that they can make huge profits from the lending of money and the marketing of securities — an outlook which deserves the adjectives “selfish” and “opportunist.”

Franklin Delano Roosevelt (1882-1945) American lawyer, politician, statesman, US President (1933-1945)
Speech (1932-05-22), Commencement, Oglethorpe University, Atlanta, Georgia

Sourcing, notes: wist.info/roosevelt-franklin-d…

record.bridgyOriginalText:
A quotation from Montesquieu

Lying is a base vice, and painted in its most shameful colors by one of the ancients, who says that to lie is to give proof that you despise God and at the same time are afraid of men.
 
[C’est un vilain vice, que le mentir ; & qu’un ancien peint bien honteusement, quand il dit, que c’est donner tesmoignage de mespriser Dieu, & quand & quand de craindre les hommes.]

Michel de Montaigne (1533-1592) French essayist
Essays, Book 2, ch. 18 (2.18), “Of Giving the Lie [Du desmentir]” (1578) [tr. Zeitlin (1934)]

Sourcing, notes, other translations: wist.info/montaigne-michel-de/…
